item.title: By: Sarah Cosper
item.dc:creator: Sarah Cosper
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/brush-up-part-2/#comment-217">Tis</a>.
Yep! That works. I've done that too. That's pretty hardcore, Tisha!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tis.

Yep! That works. I’ve done that too. That’s pretty hardcore, Tisha!

item.title: By: Tis
item.dc:creator: Tis
item.description: One weird trick for curling your eyelashes-and it may be bad, but it works for me... I have tiny eyelashes that are stick straight. No curve at all to them. Since I was in my teens, I have been using my hairdryer to "heat" my eyelash curler. Like a curling iron for your hair. I make sure that it is not too hot by holding it to my face before it gets anywhere near my eyes. Seems to help hold the "curl." If not, by the end of the day, they are once again stick straight. Just a tip for ya...
item.content:encoded: One weird trick for curling your eyelashes-and it may be bad, but it works for me… I have tiny eyelashes that are stick straight. No curve at all to them. Since I was in my teens, I have been using my hairdryer to “heat” my eyelash curler. Like a curling iron for your hair. I make sure that it is not too hot by holding it to my face before it gets anywhere near my eyes. Seems to help hold the “curl.” If not, by the end of the day, they are once again stick straight. Just a tip for ya…
